page.title: 02Butley -The Area Population
page.content: The Black Death in 1349 caused the demise of the original village near the church. Sheep became common in the area and the population remained low until arable acreage increased in the 19th Century. The population rose from 250 in 1801 to a peak in 1861 of 385. The Agricultural depression saw a decline to 270 by 1901. After some recovery the decline has continued to 195 in 1981. Recently death of the older people has resulted in the sale of their houses to people from outside Suffolk for use as holiday homes and to Americans working at the nearby twin airbases of Bentwaters and Woodbridge. An aging local population with 45% over the age of 45 and this has had a serious effect on school rolls. Few people move permanently into the area.
